Uses of SignScorer in opennlp.ccg.ngrams
 

Classes in opennlp.ccg.ngrams that implement SignScorer
 class FactoredNgramModel
          A scorer for a factored n-gram backoff model.
 class FactoredNgramModelFamily
          A scorer consisting of a family of factored n-gram backoff models.
 class KenNgramModel
           
 class LinearNgramScorerCombo
          Linear combination of n-gram probability models, interpolated at the word level; can also be used as a feature extractor in a perceptron model.
 class NgramPrecisionModel
          N-gram precision scoring model, using a linear combination of n-grams with rank order centroid weights, and optionally replacing word forms with their semantic classes.
 class NgramScorer
          Super class for n-gram scoring models.
 class RepetitionScorer
          Scores a sign according to how repetitive its words are given the observed context.
 class SignScorerInterpolation
          Linear interpolation of sign scorers, some of which may be feature extractors.
 class SignScorerProduct
          Product of sign scorers, some of which may be feature extractors..
 class SRILMNgramModel
          A language model that uses the SRI language modeling toolkit.
 class StandardNgramModel
          A scorer for a standard n-gram backoff model.

          Initialise with a language model over the output sequences and, given a List of List>'s initially tagged with "observation" probabilities (output probabilities only based on local features), return the forward-pass re-estimated probabilites of the output classes.

          Realizes the input LF relative to given sign scorer, returning the best edge found (or null if none) in the given time limit (in ms), potentially waiting longer for a complete edge according to the given flag.

          Interface for signs scorers with both a base model and a full (reranking) model.
